fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A story about South Africa's planned Medupi power plant meant to say that the controversial coal-fired station is expected to put out 25m tonnes of carbon dioxide a year, not 25 tonnes (World Bank's $3.75bn coal plant loan defies critics, 9 April, page 26). • The caption on a picture of a rally in support of Hungary's far-right Jobbik party gave the location as Bucharest instead of Budapest (Hungary party set to follow European extremists' move away from fringes, 9 April, page 27). • In a pair of stories about the aftermath in South Africa of the murder of Eugene Terre'Blanche, his farm was sited correctly near Ventersdorp, in the North West Province, but also Ventersdrop and Venterdsorp (White supremacists vow revenge; Controversial figure's death stirs up fear and anger, both 5 April, pages 14-15). • A repeat offender put in an appearance when a comment piece said that the World Health Organisation "refuted" the accusation that it was susceptible to pressure from pharmaceutical companies. That should have been rebutted (The great flu conspiracy, 8 April, page 34). • In a panel giving ideas for children's snacks (Oat cuisine, 9 April, page 19, G2), we omitted to credit Tara Fisher for the photographs. • A listing in Saturday's paper for today's BBC2 programme with Michael Cockerell, How to win the TV debate, was incorrect. It said the programme, at 7pm, is a repeat. It is in fact a new programme.
